definition: Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
Wu Yuzhang (1878-1966), writer, educator and communist politician
anti-imperialist movement of 30th May 1925, involving general strike esp. in Shanghai, Guangzhou, Hong Kong etc
the New Culture Movement (mid-1910s and 1920s), intellectual revolution against Confucianism aiming to introduce Western elements, especially democracy and science
Liao Mosha (1907-1990), journalist and communist propagandist, severely criticized and imprisoned for 10 years during the Cultural Revolution

Qu Qiubai (1899-1935), politician, Soviet expert of the Chinese communists at time of Soviet influence, publisher and Russian translator, captured and executed by Guomindang at the time of the Long March
Li Dazhao (1889-1927), early Chinese Marxist and founding member of the communist party
Zou Taofen (1895-1944), journalist, political theorist and publisher
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
anti-imperialist/anti-imperialists
abbr. for 五卅運動|五卅运动[wu3 sa4 yun4 dong4], The May Thirtieth Movement (1925)
to save from extinction/to save the nation
Zhang Shizhao (1881-1973), revolutionary journalist in Shanghai, then established writer
opposing Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 in War of national protection 1915-1916/same as 反袁鬥爭|反袁斗争
